The large park is very close to the metro station with only about 5 minutes walk away. We went there in the late afternoon and took a lot of beautiful pictures. There were ducks, cats, birds, tortoise, fishes with local people walking this dogs, it was relaxing and enjoyable.

This place is simply amazing, a clear lake sorrounded by trees, benches to sit, where to exercise, lots of birds, incredible restaurants and the most amazing theatre I’ve seen, you have to visit!!! Walking around is the most incredible thing in this place, the cafeteria is the

Ohori Park surpasses the definition of a dream park. Not only is it a relaxing stroll, the residents seem to also make it a part of their daily lives! It is a sprawling beauty and teams with giant koi fish, ducks, birds, turtles, crows, pigeons, and a most marvelous array of
The park is beautiful, but very small. It is a great place for the locals to jog or walk along the lake but not significant enough for tourists to visit.

If you need to visit somewhere rather quiet in the natural setting in this city, either by yourself,with family or friends this park is a perfect spot. You can walk along the lake watching the birds life in the centre, sit on benches to relax or picnic, do some light exercise

This is indeed a beautiful park and the only reason why it has an average score, is because it is not quite an essential place to visit, especially if you have limited time. It is a large park, with a beautiful lake in the middle, which has some really large kois and fishes, as

We ended up visiting this place almost every afternoon as we stayed close by and it’s a great place with a marked running and cycling track. You can rent a paddle boat, grab a Starbucks, play on kids play equipment or just stroll the lake. Great place for people of all ages and

Beautiful place to relax and unwind. Very clean and the location is perfect when visiting Fukuoka! It is a quite popular place for tourist and locals alike but it is very spacious to notice the many people here!
Very near to Subway station. with big lake and clear water. we arrived around 2pm but surrounding with local people. Peace and relaxing place. if your time allowed please walk a full circle.
Nice place to spend some time to relax or just have a walk. Also close to the Castle ruins. Popular also among the locals

The park is really spacious and quiet. A lot of people just bring their lunch box here and enjoy their lunch. We had a coffee at the Starbucks in the park. If the weather is nice is really a lovely chill time.

I've been coming to this park for years. It does get busy in the peak times but overall it is a great place to take a walk and stretch your legs a bit. There seem to be more things to do at the park now more than ever. From the starbucks to the other restaurants located near the

We went to Ohori Park and the Fukuoka Castle. It was late March, and the Sakura were in full bloom. It was beautiful, though pretty crowded too. We also went to the Japanese Garden there, and took a swan boat out on the water. The swan boat was fun for the kids (and only 30
Nice park for a stroll to relax and smell the flowers. Lucky to be able to catch the sakura at Ohori, along with the tulips and peonies too!

The park is so beautiful! If you have one day to explore fukuoka... this place should be in your itinerary. The relaxing vibe the lake gives during the early afternoon. Very near to subway station and you can cross the other side to see the fukuoka castle ruins. 2 places at
Best place so far in Fukuoka, I love this beautiful park and they have japanese garden and castle ruins.

This park is very reminiscent of Hoan Kiem Park in Hanoi-Big closed off loop to vehicles with island in the middle with attractive bridges and pavilions. The big loop is heavily used by joggers and bikers, so walkers have to be careful. Fishing is prohibited, but that didn't
When you have some time go for walk! It's a really nice park, however it is really crowded there during the weekend.

WOW, what a splendid park. Huge open area in the middle of a large city. The lake is gorgeous with all sorts of small craft to rent. The bridge is beautiful as is the playground. Vendors have everything you need to eat or drink. The families were there with the most adorable

We had an afternoon in Fukuoka before flying home and spent a glorious sunny afternoon at the park. It was an unseasonably warm Saturday during cherry blossom season and there were thousands of people here, but even then, there were plenty of quiet spots to enjoy the sun and a

This is a must when cherry blossom is in season. It takes your breadth away. There was a fair with delicacies being sold and people with their families having picnics. The Park has ponds and bridges and a Japanese garden. Well worth a visit. I am not sure if it would be this
Visited during Cherry Blossom end March 2018. Excellent place to see Cherry Blossom. Lovely park and nice Spring weather. Easy accessible from Subway, super convenient and worth a visit.

Visited it on 1 Apr 2018 - height of the sakura bloom - and I loved it. People having picnics around sakura trees with many food stalls and it is a lovely scene. Park is huge and well maintained, and very near to the city center. Recommended.

Great park to take the family, especially in cherry blossom season. Would recommend hiring one of the swan boats for a paddle around the lake. Great running track around the perimeter for any runners/walkers (2km marked in 100m increments).

Perfect day in the Ohori Park. Spring finally came as temperature rose to the 15-19 C degrees when we last visited on March 25.. Some of the cherry blossoms are already in full bloom and for a first timer to see it i really would like to capture that picture in my mind

I was early for the cherry blossoms but it was still a lovely walk around Ohori Park. There were lots of flowers around and bring light food/snacks and drinks and have a picnic while resting on the many benches available by the water. Very serene and peaceful place to be. It was

Plan a half-day outing here, and leisurely walk around the park. We did not expect the park to be so big and only walked about one-third way around the lake, as we had other plans that day. Many of the locals were either exercising or walking their dogs but they al kept to

Ohori Park's Japanese Garden is one of the best in the Fukuoka area. Listed in "Hidden Gardens of Japan": THE photo essay and reference for finding unspoiled gardens in Japan (minus the tour bus mobs) available on Amazon US and Amazon Japan

Even in the winter, Ohiri Park is lovely. Lots of people strolling around the lake. Late January, the swan boats were returned to the lake giving us hope that spring may be on the way. The gardens must be beautiful in season.

Akin to Central Park in NYC, this is a lovely park with a big lake. What a great place for a stroll, a job, and a meeting with friends. There are plenty of places to sit, and there are playgrounds and exercise areas. Do stop by here if ever in Fukuoka.
quiet clean nice park to visit and stroll around. Dont expect anything fancy since there are really no fancy attractions except the beautiful body of water as the centerpiece.
This place is simply amazing, a clear lake sorrounded by trees, benches to sit, where to exercise, lots of birds, incredible restaurants and the most amazing theatre I’ve seen, you have to visit!!!
Wandered through the park on a very rainy day. Thoroughly enjoyed the lake, especially the mini recreation of West Lake in Hangzhou.

Date of visit: Dec 26, 2017 / Weather temp: 7 degrees This park is beautiful and well-maintained. Nothing much to see but if you are looking for a peaceful and quiet stroll, this is the place to go to. It’s a big park with a huge lake in the middle. Boat rentals were

My family enjoyed our stroll around the park. There were some other tourists and Japanese students gathering around the park. As the weather was really comfortable, we enjoyed the walk and view in the park.
This is the place to see and be seen in Fukuoka. This is the location of the annual fireworks show (quite amazing) and hordes of daily walkers, joggers and couples. Must see if visiting Fukuoka.

We went during the mid-December period, when Fukuoka and surrounds were very chilly. The park itself was lovely - it was large and there was much foliage. However, because we went in winter, there wasn't much foliage. The pavilion in the middle of the lake, modelled after the

A public park with a large pond in the heart of the park, that a large number of tourists and locals visit and do activities such as exercising, biking, and just relax in the midst of a beautiful landscape. Ohori Park also has a variety of cherry blossoms that you can enjoy

After our walking tour of temples we took the subway to Ohori Park which is a centre of nature and activity around a very large lake . There are lots of people enjoying the weather , walkinf , biking and running but our goal was to visit the Japanese Garden . The entrance fee

If you are looking for a great place to get out and take in some sunshine and fresh air then Ohori Park is the place to be. A lovely long walking path surrounds the lake. Cyclists and joggers also share the path but it is wide and accommodates many. There are great places to sit

I love Ohori. The park is well-laid out for walkers, joggers and cyclists. It's a place for people watching, romantic dates, nice walks in the evening, hanging out with friends or walking your dog. It gets super crowded in summer and during events (especially fireworks), but if

"Ohori Park is a pleasant city park in central Fukuoka with a large pond at its center. There is a walking path around the circumference of the pond that is just a little over two kilometers long and is popular for jogging, walking pets and leisurely strolls by the water.

A large and well maintained park with a lake. Boats can be hired but expensive whilst there is a lakeside restaurant. Set lunch reasonable value and quality. But soft drinks excessively priced compared to comparable restaurants elsewhere in Fukuoka.

Came here after visiting Fukuoka Castle Ruins. This place is good to visit if weather is not hot. Good to have a drink at Statbuck looking out to the lake. Overall still worthwhile to walk over if you happened to be nearby

Walk along the lakeside and meander the various paths under the trees. There’s not much here and that’s fine, but if you are looking for a garden experience look elsewhere, in fact, look to Ohorikoen Japanese Garden very near the park. A few bridges, islands with birds, a lake

This park is really cool. There is a bike/run lane around the circumference for exercise, a boathouse where you can rent row or paddle boats, and bridges linking the series of islands on the pond. There were coy fish in the pond that were the size of a small child! Very pleasant

Dont expect is very special park but is a lovely with lake park.It is very easy to reach there and best for walking,or with kids to have fun.If you have time is worth to visit here for one to two hours stay.
Lucky to be there. Very local park. Lots of families with kids and dome couples. Big lake, starbucks, and lots of benches. Good to be there on bike.
Great park with a lake and a Japanese garden nearby. Best Japanese garden in Kyushu don't miss this wonderful

Lovely place to just pack a bento box or onigiri and munch away while sitting on a bench overlooking the lake. Great place for a run too ! Take the subway to ohorikoen station and get off exit 3 and walk up the stairs. Continue to walk straight after the stairs and turn left
Lovely large park in the middle of a busy hot summer city. A great retreat form all the shopping and hustle and bustle of Fukuoka
In this beautiful place you can find all the peace you need. There is uncontaminated nature and there are a lot of animals. I love Ohori Park!

This location has it all! We came here as we awaited our flight 9 hours after arrival in Fukuoka. The kids played in the park all morning then we ate at the restaurant on site. It was delicious by the way. Later we saw the Fukuoka Castle ruins, enjoyed the flowers and

It's a massive park with magnificent views. Inspired by the West Lake in Hangzhou, China, Ohori Park is an oasis in bustling Fukuoka. Once you get there, you will have a chance to enjoy several other attractions like the Fukuoka Castle ruins, Fukuoka Art Museum and the Japanese

The park is next to the old castle's ruins. It is a beautiful and clean park. You can rent pedal boats: either the regular kind where you sit down into a big "swan" which offers cover from the sun and can fit up to 4 people, or a kind of bike on surfboards good for 2 people.
Nice area for relaxation. If you want to get away from the bustling city atmosphere then this park can be recommended. A walk crossing the lake through the bridges and the island is a must.
This was our goal today and we loved being here. The park is very nice and we loved the lake particularly the pedal boats! We took our time wandering around. YMMV

This is a very scenic place to exercise. There is a track for running and walking. Benched to sit and look at the lake. There are cafes and PINKBERRY!!!! There is a really cool playground that I have been tempted to play on.
We went to the embassy near to the park and I was waiting my fiancee here. Even it is summer but there was a wind blow around me!

Nestled within the hustle and bustle of town is this beautiful, peaceful oasis. So lovely to see so many people walking their dogs, exercising and just enjoying the views across the lovely lake and gardens. Look for the turtles in the lake! Don't miss a visit to the traditional
A very nice park to have a walk in and relax. You'll also get to see some wildlife in form of hegrets and turtles.

Went to Fukuoka on a business trip. One of our business partners took us here via trains. It was a nice walkabout with beautiful scenery of the lake in the middle. There were a few attractions nearby as well.
I can say that ohori park is a must visit park in Fukuoka. It has a very beautiful view and located near Some attractions such as Fukuoka castle, Japanese garden, and fukuoka museum.

We visited in the summer so there wasn't much in bloom and it was almost boring for me. It was a great walk, though! My favorite part was the zen garden. It was so picturesque that when we were there, there were two Japanese couples having their prenuptial photo shoot. :)

Scrolled around town and came to Ohori Park. This park is very big and there were many people running, jogging, biking and walking, some with dogs. You can also rent a paddle boat, or paddle bicycle and ride in the large pond here. You place to relax.

We went to the park in late afternoon on a Sunday. It's a popular recreational park for local families. Thankfully we come in good walking shoes as there's a fair bit to cover on foot. We enjoyed strolling along the big lake as well as walking to the ruins of Fukuoka castle and

The park is a great place to go for a coffee and to relax. It can get a bit crowded on weekends with families, teens, dogs, children, joggers, cyclists and tourists but go on a weekday for a walk around and I think you'll find it an enjoyable place to be. There are swanboats and

Ohori Park is a great place for relaxing with friends and having an afternoon stroll. It's located in the middle of Fukuoka city and is fairly easy to get to. The pond is great and one part has a bridge leading to a pavilion. There is a Japanese garden nearby which is worth a

Its us a good park in the middle of the city, and can be visited for slight recreation and jogging. There is a huge and beautiful well maintained lake. You can also do fishing and there are designated places for the same. There are refreshment areas including a Starbucks It is

You can stroll, jog or peddle a floating 'duck' on the lake which is built in the style of China's famous West Lake. There are eating options - and after Cherry Blossom time we were luck to stumble upon the Beer and Food Festival - definitely worth a visit to see how the
I think this park is a good place for a local people to run, relax, coffee chat which the park has a Starbuck next to the canel.
Large beautiful park for a good stroll or jog. We stopped to take short breaks and snacked, and also a long cafe break at Starbucks. Good for people who just enjoy parks.

We thought to visit something else than shopping with our kid of 2. We decided to try the park. Indeed it turns out quite well. Not only it's convenient to the centre (as it's near the train station) but also there are a few kids facility Swan boat at the lake - it's something

We went here for some peace and quite and surely found it. Nice big park around a big pond where they rent out several kind of boats. Starbucks and several lunch area precent. We had lunch at a nice bench in the shade (7-eleven right across the main entrance of the park - use
Hard to believe how quiet and peaceful it is here in the middle of a big city. I like to walk out on the Islands, sit in the shade and read a book. Easy access by subway or bus.

The park is in downtown. You can go to Hilton for lunch or afternoon tea after visiting the park. The park mimics West lake in China but it's smaller with fewer ppl. I quite like it as its a nice walk around the lake. But the best part is the Japanese garden in the park. It's so

The park can be accessed by the subway bearing the same name. As the name implies, it is one huge park with water feature and looks more like a semi vegetated garden area. Mobile food vendors are available at some entrances. Toilet facilities are also there. There is a stadium

This was a great walking experience.The many parts of the park was explained to us by a wonderful guide , Seigo.The cherry blosson trees were at their best. A mid week visit meant that the paths weren't over-run.The river, the gardens and the ruins of the ancient castle , the
Park was wonderful. Easy to navigate & well maintained. Loved the many fish & turtles. Also enjoyed the many dance groups practicing.

They have paddle boats shaped as swans!! Need I say more. I visited in spring so it was in full bloom and beautiful! As I mentioned they have paddle boats and kayaks for rent. It is a lovely trail to walk around. There are parks and scenic ruins along the parks exterior. It is a

The park is basically a very large pond with nice jogging/ walking trail and a very nice Starbucks. For visitors, it is very average. And really only worth the time if you want to clock some exercise steps.

We visited in April when the cherry blossoms were out and on this Sunday there was a family day on. Many families had bought mats and were sitting having a picnic lunch under the cherry blossom trees. There were also stalls selling a variety of foods. The Kanazawa castle is
I highly recommend this place. It's calming and the swan boats are something to experience. There's also a great picnic area too.
What a park! It's beautiful to walk on a sunny day. We did both, sunny and rainy/windy day. Sunny was better. Windy/rainy almost blew us away.

A big park that's great for relaxing and enjoying the lake view. The nearby cafes offer a good chilling time as well. The walk through the bridge reminds me of the walk through Arashiyama. May have to be careful of the small flies and pollen that's floating in the air though.
We went on the one day all the pine trees were releasing their pollen so there was a lot of yellow pollen in The water . Great wee spot for a walk
A short travel from the Hakata JR station. The park offer a place for one to relax, do jogging or some exercise, or hang out.

This is a family friendly parks and handicapped accessible. There is something for everyone. There is a playground, swan boats ride, cherry blossoms, picnic area and history- Fukuoka castle ruins and Najima gate. If you stay nearby, I would recommend the park for a nice jog. The

walkable from the subway... theres parking too its sakura season, the park has 2 sides (BYO bbq style where you see alot of locals under the sakura trees making merry) the other had some food stalls... and the potato fries is a must! im afraid my review wld not be relevant
This is a great place with a big lake. It's weird to see a Starbucks amidst such beautiful nature, but hey, you can either go there or not. The castle ruins are nearby and worth a stroll as well.

Ohori park is a huge waste of space and time. It serves a purpose of walking, jogging and or cycling. There is a sad playground and a Starbucks. It could be so awesome. The trees are boring and most of the open spaces are overgrown with weeds. There used to be a big homeless
Ohori Park is ideal for stroll and logging as a couple. A coffee shop with a good view of the lake for the less active. Ideal for couples on a sunny day.

Best visited during the Cherry Blossom period. They have good stalls all over which serve hot and freshly prepared Japanese delicacies. Must try is their takoyaki! At night, they have a light show! The trees are lit and are so very beautiful. Truly a must see! Bring your

Never miss this if you are in Fukuoka. Its around 5 subway stations away from Hakata, and the place is huge! I especially love the huge lake in the middle, and there are ducks and swan frolicking in the water. Exiting the Ohorikoen station, it is just a 2-minute walk to the

Ohori Park is nice in any season to stroll and look around and people watch. A museum on the grounds has very good exhibits that are regularly added, so check to see what is currently showing at the museum. Most recently, I went cherry blossom viewing there and it was lovely.
We visited here to see around, there are a lot to see and very peaceful scenery but since it is cherry season it was very crowded.
Hanami parties in full swing as everyone awaits for full blossoms. Two cafes on site with delicious breads, coffee and yogurt. Swan boats and bicycles available for rent

This park is well suited for all lifestyles. When you do visit here, you'll find a lot of people jogging, cycling, walking, strolling. It's a very relaxed park with a big pond right in the middle. What I think we did right though was that we got a bike to roam around Fukuoka
Must visit if in Fukuoka. I can only imagine what it will be like in Sakura season. Highly recommended - make sure not to give this a miss.

I can only imagine how beautiful this spacious park would be when all the cherry blossoms lining the lake and across the running path comes into bloom, but even in winter, this park is lovely to take a stroll in. Across the lake there are three stone bridges to cross, all with
Ohori Park is one of the most beautiful places I have had the privilege to visit. The gardens are most tranquil and perfectly manicured. A must see if in Fukuoka.

Very peaceful, quiet, clean park with a lake, many trees and resting spots in it. There are clean public toilets available for visitors. It was warmer than I expected when I visited there, so I left my 2 layer of clothes in 2 different sections of the park before I run. When I
Good place to go if one has free or spare time. It's a big park with a nice lake and a cafe. Super cold n windy during winter.
if the weather is good, i would exercise here, definitely. Nice coffee shop is near here. Starbucks view was good.
If you dream a peaceful and relaxable place, you should go odori park There are many people here but all of them were quiet You can find pigeons and gooses too Entirely good experience

Ohori Park is a huge park, with many outdoor activities possible. It has jogging paths, art museum, beautiful gardens and cafes. There are bridges connecting islands in the middle of the huge man-made lake. It is good to sit and relax in this area after visiting the Fukuoka

We enjoyed the paths through sports fields, manicured gardens and castle ruins. In winter, it is not crowded but there was a "buzz" about the place. We moved on to quieter areas when the tour buses arrived.
Had a lovely walk through Ohori park in the morning, even though it was cold. Big lake and you could walk through the set of bridges and cross the entire park. There is also a jogging track around.
Ohori park is very nice especially on sunny day. Dog-watching at the park is definitely great activity. It is the park you can truly blend in with locals.

I strolled here while walking to Tenjin. A good place for exercise and group stroll in the park at night with some lights displayed around the park. There are also cafes to enjoy the view of the lake.

built next to fukuoka castle, it is a beautiful man made park that serve as a refuge for people tired of the city. Just sitting down in one of the bench makes you really cozy and relax. What a peaceful park

We had been told that there were extensive lights on at the park in December. We came out between Christmas and New Year. We like the park. Only a short underground ride from Tenjin. Lights not as impressive as we had hoped but pleasant walk and able to stop for coffee half way
A quiet natural experience, beautiful surrounding. Visited on Christmas eve, Great lighting. One of the best in Fukuoka.

The park actually is a lake with a few islands in the middle which are linked by bridges. It is nice to walk along the shores or to those islands. The lake is full of life, birds and fishes. Local people like to jog around the lake.
Nice lights in the late evening . There was a cafe within the park premises. Saw joggers and cyclists in the park. It was 7 degrees cold!

We did a walk from the subway station first to Maizuru Park and then to Ohori Park. Though Ohori Park has nothing spectacular and it is puzzling while it is the top attraction, I would say it was nice walking around and a good way to spend a couple of hours. We found the Boat

A much desired and needed greenery break in the city ! It is a very refreshing and relaxing walk round the pond , with a coffee break at the Starbucks outlet and a few exercise stations to do a quick workout ! A short walk to Tenjin !

We went and visited the castle ruins one November morning and it was absolutely empty, which was brilliant, as we had just come from Osaka and Kyoto where the place was always incredibly busy! We got some beautiful views of the city skyline and enjoyed wandering around here
A nice walk in the park in December. No feeding of the ducks though. The koi is very big and you will enjoy them swimming leisurelybwjile it calms your mind.

We visited on a lovely evening in late spring. We enjoyed an ice cream sitting by the water watching toddlers feed the fish, then strolled though the lake via the connected islands. It was calm and serene, dotted with people fishing and sketching. When we reached the lake

This Japanese garden is well regarded by the to-be-married couples as a perfect backdrop for their outdoor wedding pictures. It is located at the southern part of the Ohori Park and is closed on Mondays. There is a small entrance fee but it is is all worth it. Besides the usual
Just a beautiful place to walk and watch the locals at play. Must be great for the people of Fukuoka.

Ohori Park is to place to jogg around. There's like 2km long jogging track around the lake. You can also visit and small island in the middle of the lake. Views are not that good. But it's okay place to spend some time on a sunny day. There's also few cafes if you don't have
Peaceful place to walk or sit, away from the city traffic. Walking, riding and jogging track all the way around the lake, close to the Castle ruins as a side trip.

The quiet lake can be crossed end to end by a succession of bridges and small islands covered with pine trees, or by walking around. Runners can enjoy a soft path. Two coffee shops with beautiful view.

We were here on a Sunday so there were lots of people, families, pet owners with pets, joggers and bikers. The volume of people is not disturbing either. It made the visit more colorful as Japanese people are great subjects to watch. They're very disciplined. They have lanes for

If just walking there is an art museum, coffee shop and plenty of seating all around the park. Fitness spaces and a 2 kilometre oval running /walking circuit. Lots of birds and carp coming to the pond. Also boating in good weather during mid spring to mid fall.
This is a nice calm and quiet park in Fukuoka. I went there during the summer of 2003 and it was a great place to relax from the city.

The park itself is huge with lots of tree and wonderful lake ... but don't recommend to go in the summer as there are not many shaded areas... I like walking in the middle of the lake... it felt nice to be away from the city..and cool breeze helped with the heat of summer

Great to walk and people watch, enjoyed the many formally dressed tiny dogs, saw a crane catch a fish, look closely in the bushy areas to see feral cats, grab a latte at the starbucks (on the lake near the path to Fukuoka Castle), and you can rent a pedal powered swan boat which
After a long day in crowded downtown quarters this is the right place to take a walk and enjoy the wide space of Ohori Park (Subway station is nearby)

Really dated playground, but that's part of its charm! The kids spent a lot of time at the playground, and we didn't have much time to explore more of the park. Lots of locals, almost no tourists here.
If the weather is nice, head to Ohori Kouen for a lovely stroll to view a quiet place for Japanese relaxation.
I love history and there is the ruins of Fukuoka castle on the grounds of the park. Very interesting!
Beautiful park to take a stroll in and relax. Big loop around the outside of a water feature to run if you need some fitness.
Great cherry blossoms ... unfortunately, a whole bunch of other people think so, too! But still worth a stroll on a spring day!

We started our afternoon walk from the castle and then passed a green playground to arrive at the big lake surrounded by a wide road for walking, jogging or cycling, colored with sunflowers and typical Asian willows. There are plenty of benches to have a rest. This is a place to

with kids playground. near subway station. has a starbucks (with wifi), yogurt shop, and another restaurant for you to stay or grab a bite. has pedal boat, paddle boat, to go around the lake. jogging path and bike path, also nice to stroll your baby around.
It's a beautiful lake park in the city. Many people were out the day we went. There is a pretty traditional garden and an art museum on the grounds.

The walk around was ok, not much special to see to be honest.. couldn't go into the Japanese gardens, which I assume would have lifted my opinion a bit. The weather wasn't great which didn't help either..
We walked around the waterway and then into the park. Would be a lovely place for a picnic, or to lay and read a book in the shade.
Nice park in the center of Fukuoka, with a big artificial lake. Possible to rent some rowing and pedal boats. Nice for a stroll.

The Boathouse restaurant is a nice amenity-- but the park itself offers lovely lakeside strolls and a lovely traditional Japanese Garden. Unbearably hot in August -- but there are enough places to cool off.

Pedal swan boats, two playgrounds (one of them huge!), an art museum, cafes, Japanese garden with tea ceremony, and even fishing and bird feeding spots. Beautiful design, a wonderful shaded walk through the central pond, and easy access to Maizuru park and its rolling lawns,
It is a great place to have a walk/jog and enjoy the scenery. It can be scorching hot during summer though, remember to apply sun block or bring an umbrella to avoid getting sun burn.

here with wife and baby. Very pleasant walk with views. Would be a fantastic jog around the pond or through the middle. It has nice viewing spots and playgrounds spotted along the way. Also a cafe and a very eco/green Starbucks. Literally 2 min from subway station. When the sun

We brought our kids to the Art Museum and the children playground. The kids naturally thought playing in the park was much better than shopping in a department store. Even though it was a scalding hot day. There are bridges that span across the lake, which make the park a bit

Ohori park may not be as iconic as Shinjuku gyoen, but it's as relaxing as a small town park. Not a lot of tourists here. THere's a pink berry and a couple of restaurants at the edge of the lake. The lake is huge, very nice to jog. But on a hot summer day, people would rather
A walk under a hot sunny day in Fukuoka. Interesting concept of park but much more recommendable for fresher days. During the sub time, please do not go. You do not enjoy that much the walk.
Fukuoka is a fairly uneventful city - I was passing through to visit a friend. This park is fairly nice to cycle around or explore if you need something to do, just don't expect anything unique.

Safe and quiet environment. Great for family activities. Jogging, bicycling, walking, riding Swan boat, anyway you chose. 2 stops from Tenjin by subway. You can also visit the City Art Gallery in the park as well as Starbucks to have a cup of coffee
Love this beautiful park with the lake view. We manage to walk around the whole park and took a lot of awesome photo. It's kind of hot during summer day. Do use sun block before you go

This free park is very large and is planned around a huge lake with a string of islands running down the middle. There are bridges that allow you to go down islands which are planted with pine trees and other local fauna. There are boats for rent including the big paddle

Beautiful expanse of land and water! A great jogging route even for marathoners! Lucky if you get to see catfish or turtle in the large lake during your meditation! Good Zen place to sit and enjoy the view and air. Bonus is that it's just a 500 meter walk to the Fukuoka

We went just to see the place and was quite taken with the size of the park in Central Fukuoka. If outdoor activities is what you want to do, then this is the place. But the weather now - sunny- and the heat is not a good combination to enjoy the place.
A very lovely park in the city which is great to use as a get away from daily business. Peaceful and fun. The park has paddle boats, row boats, Starbucks, snack shops and dining.
has subway and bus access, great area for long walks to the fukuoka castle ruins, great for jogging too
We enjoyed the history explanations. I would have liked more historical stories. The lake was peacefull. By the time we got to the boat rides we were too tired.to row or pedal.
Pretty park area along with the ruins well worth a few hour visit. There are plenty of nearby attractions, and also some paddle boat rentals on the lake as well as some cafes.

Ohori Park is situated from all sides with Lake in between.U can have a 360 Degree Look of the same.many families and Lovers singles come here where u get real Silence.No one to disturb,lots of space all over.A must Visit Place
There are a lot of walking paths here, as well as a good sized pond with pedal boats and a small cafe. It is a nice oasis in a bustling area, and there is a lovely, small shrine, too.

Must Visit. Nice park in Fukuoka city center. Around 5 mins by bus from Tenjin area. This park has a jogging track, bicycle track and playground for the kids. You can also find a floating resto that just re-open a few months ago. There is a nice museum near the park and a
What a beautiful place! It's located directly in the city center and is near the castle ruins. It's very relaxing to come here and enjoy the great atmosphere.
Beautiful and amazing. Atmospher was so pleasent. Swan boat adds to the charm. Marine life attracts you. Pigeon, fish and turtles are just handy. Children can play games.

Ohori park in conveniently located right off the subway line. Inspired by the People Park in Shanghai the park has a huge man made lake dotted by several mini-islands thoughts center and connected by a chinese bridge and mini-gazibo. Its a popular jogging spot for locals and

I just loved the turtles in the lake. There's a great walking path that's easy to follow and takes you on a circuit of the lake; there are also other areas of park to explore. Great place to stretch your legs.

A pleasant and calming place to walk around. Next to the park are the ruins of the castle. I visited the Fukuoka Art Museum to see a Salvador Dali (excellent and exquisite detail), and Andy Warhol's Elvis. Note the art museum is closing in September 2016 and will not reopen

This is a nice big park located right in the middle of the city and easily within reach via the subway. Though it is not really that fantastic - perhaps due to the time of my visit in Jun 2016 when not many flowers are in bloom - it offers a serene and quiet getaway from the
Very famous and popular place for local people. You can running around the park, actually many runners. Good place to relax.

Fukuoka is blessed with plenty of open spaces and areas to spend sunny weather in, Ohori Park has to be right at the top of pile. Originally a moat for Fukuoka Castle, the ruins of which lay nearby, Ohori Park is the perfect place to spend a warm summer's evening. First opened

There are ducks and Terrapins in the pond, and a playground for children. Lots of people walking dogs, and a very nice atmosphere, even in the summer. There is a very nice Japanese garden beside the park (entrance fee needed) and a boathouse for people to dine at. The pond
Many families with prams and children playing by the pond and the sand area. Good for a relaxing day out or a picnic.
Refreshing and quiet part of the city. You can spend 2-3 hours here while people watching. Take the kuko line 6

Great place to go for a morning run or picnic. Other attractions are just within walking distance. There's a Mister Donuts Cafe just outside the park for your caffeine fix before you explore the area! Check out the huge carps and turtles on the lake :)

This park incorporates a large large lake (2.2km footpath around) with footpath crossing from North to South. There is the remains of a large Castle from which we can gather the original size but not the structure; Two of the Gates exist. There is a restaurant, cafe and quite a
Wonderful place. I loved visiting all the great shops at Canal City. It is also well know for its Tonkotsu Ramen at the street stalls. Its my 4th visit to Fukuoka so I think that speaks for itself.
While it is a far cry from the popular hanami spots around Japan, this is probably the best in Fukuoka. And there isn't as much crowd as the rest, which makes it a good relaxing stroll in the area.

You can get the real of relaxing moment in here, Ohori park. There is the wonderful japanese garden stlye with beautiful flowers and many kind of three. You can take rest in here with listen to the sound of water falls.

We went there twice! Perfect for family with baby or small kid. We had a nice time there with our baby son. He enjoyed the nice weather and all the fish in the big pond. Too bad we could not get on the rental boat coz there was a long line. By the way, the Japanese Garden
Ohori park a big park in fukuoka nice view nice weather many people in fukuoka come to relax in this park all day in this park

This is a really beautiful park. My children ages 10 yrs and 6 yrs old enjoyed the playground. The park was clean and well maintained. The boats weren't open when we visited but it looked like that would be fun for the kids. The park had a great Starbucks in the park with a
This park was not included in my english language travel guide: what a loss it would have been to missed it. Huge park with a big lake: you can rent paddle boats to go out in it.

We enjoyed a morning exercise by walking around the park. We fed the sea gulf when we strolled through the small strip of land in the middle of the pond. The Japanese garden is splendid and eye-opening. Finally, the blossoming sakura makes our visit there much rewarding.

Fun park with lots to do and see - castle (?) ruins, lake, cherry trees (good for visits in April), restaurants, and of course lots of grass and benches. Definitely a nice way to spend an afternoon with family or alone.
There are designated lanes for bikes for walkers and for joggers. Nice relaxing view. No fishing allowed but I think you can feed the ducks. There were hawks too.

Just went there on April 1st right on Cherry Blossom season, a lovely place to enjoy hanami. The food stalls are cheap and unexpectedly very delicious! I recommend the Hokkaido Potato and Grilled Octopus. Don't forget to wear coat or glove because on the lakeside the wind is

The Sakura were in full bloom in this amazing park. We went last Saturday. If you walk up near the castle ruins there were many people picnicking under the trees and enjoying wine and beers. It was a beautiful sight. Also, there were several food stands set up down near the

This is a place for families and friends and couples and even by yourself. There are boats to rent, a wonderful art museum, cherry trees, green space and even a Starbucks. Plan to spend most of the day there exploring and relaxing.

Unexpectedly nice park. Very busy as the blossom was in full bloom - everyone was setting up their picnic areas under the trees - a great atmosphere. Definitely an oasis in what is otherwise a very urban setting. Worth a trip and very easily accessible by metro.

We arrived during sakura season so naturally this was our first stop. It's really refreshing to see and beautiful. I can't forget the lone pink tree we saw with the cherry blossoms. The food stalls lined up selling traditional food for the hanami crowd were also a nice touch. A

Visited the park last weekend. There were lots of family having picnics and bbq-ing away. Quite a few cyclists and joggers going round the park too. The Sakura flowers are in bloom which makes the park even more pleasing. There are more Sakura trees in the adjacent Maizuru park
Expect to walk a lot because the park is huge, but very beautiful. If you're in Fukuoka for cherry blossoms though, the place to go is Fukuoka Castle.
This place is packed for cherry blossom viewing. We did not do the night viewing. Tennis courts ( you must reserve!) track, Fukuoka castle ruins. Across the street is a different park.

My daughter and I visited Ohori Park right after visiting the Castle Ruins. It is just near the Ruins and it was also a nice site for cherry blossoms viewing. One attraction of Ohori Park is the Japanese Garden and it was indeed a very serene place. After paying the

This Ohori park is mostly for leisure if you have time , it got a great pond in the middle and a tranquillized and easy to walk path around. However, you must go to the nishi park which is just few mins away.I am not sure if the Nishi park is part of the ohori koen. The nishi

If you are into jogging or chilling at the park, this would be your crib. But if you are seeking funner activities, then it's a nope. However, I would say this - the small red pavilion you'll come to after you pass the bridge is amazing. If you stand by the edge and watch the

We passed through Ohori park on our way to terumo shrine. It's a nice open space park centered around a large lake, with a walking trail through the middle. There are paddle boats and a cafe if you would like but otherwise is just a nice park.

This park is near the Fukuoka Castle ruins. You take Exit 1 to go to the park and exit 3 to go to the Ruins. However, there is a "road" (of sorts) that connects the two together (just before starbucks). The road also had lots of grilling food stalls when we went (end of March)

This is a park with large grounds where there's something to do for everyone. There's a lake where one can go boating, a children's playground, a museum, a Japanese garden (must pay to enter), lots of space for games and a picnic areas. When we were there, there were some

A large park for kids and parents to spend time together. Large lake inside with swan boat (¥1000/30min; a bit over priced). We walked and ran around. Had great time. Starbucks inside the park, with lots of tourists busy on their phones. Foodstall selling fried food at
This is an extensive park with Japanese gardens, lake, museum, cafe and a great kids playground. It also has a running path around the lake.
This huge park is really nice to walk around. Came in Sat afternoon, it was not crowded at all and very peaceful. Great place to mix with your shopping and eating tour in Fukuoka

You can stay there for whole afternoon if you want just relax! It is a big park, water is clean and the air is good! You can also take duck boat. It is a good place for picnic, also can see ducks and fish. Lots of local people just stay there for relax. It is not far from the
2km jogging road around the lake. Park is near to subway station. 15 minutes from center of the city. There is a big shrine near by.
If you want to go fukuoka castle or art museum you have to bypass this park. You can jog, walk or just enjoy it.

Took the sbway to ohorikoen, walked to Orori Park. Upon entry, there is a lot of track design for walking and running. Although the temperature was freezing, there is still a lot of people exercising. The middle of the park has a big pond with another island at the center. There
Nice place for walking/ running/ biking. With a playground. You can go to the Japanese garden within for 190 yen
Parks in Japan are always nice. We came here towards end of cherry blossom season and still managed to view some late blooms. Relaxing and easy to walk around.

The lake area In the western part of the park looks superb from all angles here, including from inside the lake on one of its cute islands and bridges. Boating, jogging also possible here. Restaurant on the lake is rustic-elegant and wifi as great as their food. Art museum and

I walked through this park on my way to the Fukuoka Art Museum which is actually located within the park grounds. The park is a beautiful oasis, with a large scenic pond surrounded by a 3 lane walkway for pedestrians, runners and cyclists. Because the park was built on the
I really love visiting city park wherever I go. And during living in Japan and visiting some cities, it is the best city park for me. The pond is like a lake: super huge, clean and peaceful.

I went to the ruins of the castle and in this park on the last day of a trip in Fukuoka, after walking in many other areas. I can clearly say it was the best spot there, the lake was very beautiful and the atmosphere was quiet and relaxing. Around me there were people jogging

Walking or running around here is extremely good idea and it is even better if the weather is good. I was there in January 2015, where the weather was around 8-12 cassius. It was a bit cold but it was still nice to be around. Drinking hot coffee at Starbuck looking around see

... Just over 2km for each lap. The best place to run in Fukuoka with clearly marked lanes and beautiful scenery. Best in the early mornings or evenings. Also a great place to just chill and enjoy the now.

Ohori Park is only about a 10 minute walk from one of the guest houses I operate in Fukuoka. It is a wonderful place to walk around, relax on the grass, or enjoy the peddle boats which are available for hire.
.....in a very big and busy city. Great for a walk or run, or sitting with a coffee. The nearby castle ruins are well worth exploring. Very well maintained, and just a really nice place to be.

Go to the boathouse, right next to it is a rental place where you can rent several waterboats/bikes. A fun and beautiful way to go around the pond and see part of the park :). After that, just walk around. The place is beautiful!

Ohori Park is a good place for you to spend time. The environment is good. You can just sit there for reading or have a lake walk. There are lovely children all around playing. There is also a coffee shop available that you can buy some snacks. I really love this park!

It was really pretty and very clean :) good for exercising too :), and in case you're tired they have starbucks and a good ice cream yoghurt in the park. Very close to the subway. A must visit at least once in Fukuoka

The park is well maintained and is a great area to just walk and wander around. It was raining when we visited but that didn't stop us from having fun. We took lots of photos at the bridge. There is a pergola that provided shelter overlooking a lake.
It was Beautiful there but it doesn't seem like there's much to do other than walk around. Nice scenario and garden. The lotus were huge! Great to bike around
Large pond with running track and bime lanes. Perfect to exercise, but also to enjoy a bit of relaxing. The Japanese garden in three park is worth a visit.
very nice for run or a walk especially during cherry blossom season, even the starbucks there has a nice athmosphere ;) check out islands on the middle of the lake!

Ohori Park is a great place for a peaceful stroll under the shade of pine trees surrounded by water. Chinese-style architecture is woven throughout, including bridges and pagodas. This free park has a nice community feel to it, and there were several couples, solo travelers, and
Lots of stuff seems to be here if you read the descriptions, but once you get here, it's not that great. Skip it if you are short on time.

It's a nice park to relax and drink some coffee. Good to visit during the late afternoon and evening to watch sunset next to the lake. I use it sometimes mainly for jogging since there is nice path around the lake with professional jogging surface. Don't recommend if you came

We had a long walk inside Ohori Park last week. There were not many visitors that day. The busiest part was the water activities centre where you can rent a little boat to row. It's a nice place to run as they have a proper running track around the park.

Large park in Fukuoka with a big pond. We went (with paid entrance) to the bucolic and serenely beautiful Japanese Garden, where we saw manicured flora/lawns/trees, small pond, streams, and waterfalls. Walked along the rocks in the middle of the flowing streams.
Go if you are in Fukuoka. Don't go if you are not. Nice stroll around the lake, in the evening is nice.
when i was visting fukuoka i was go to ohori park for rolaxing many time very nice lake i walk round lake i meet good people really is excllent place i really i want go again
After a long day of sightseeing and riding subways this is the best place to sit down, relax, and reflect.
The park was wide with a calming big lake with some ducks living on it. the place was a good place to just sit watch the lake or for doing sport.
Clean and beautiful. Good if you have your running shoes and do a jog in the park. Won't say that this is a great attraction but there is nothing much in Fukuoka honestly.

A few old stone walls and ruins of a castle provide the entrance to the castle grounds which are now Ohori Park. Easily reached by subway. The park is free and includes several attractions including; Swan boats, Japanese Garden, lake with Koi, playground, running, walking and

A great park with a lot of possibilites for a day out. There is an art museum with renowned artists and several playgrounds for kids (and adults!). The running/walking paths around the pond were excellent.

I walked (birded) the forested and roadside areas of the park to the east of the lake. This area is much less crowded. Within these other areas were some water features with lilies in bloom and large hydrangea plants in bloom as well. There is a Japanese Garden there you can

Fukuoka was recently ranked in the Top 10 of cities worldwide for livability. Parks like Ohori are one of the reasons for this ranking. Although the day was dreary and damp, walking through the park was calming and peaceful. There are all sorts of amenities, including walking,
Walking, running, cycling, you can do it all at Ohori Park. There is also a nice Japanese Garden and Museum. And Starbucks has a great spot at the Lake.
This is a lovely park for a 1-2 hour stroll. Despite the park being surrounded by the hectic streets of Fukuoka, it somehow manages to keep a tranquil atmosphere within.
Haven't see so many coy fish and turtles at one time, absolutely beautiful park. Must visit! Lots of people with kids and joggers too.

During your busy tour schedules of Hakata visiting malls, shrines and temples, do allocate half a day to visit this park for something different. Get closer to the nature and enjoy the calm and peaceful environment.
Wonderful place to do exercice, to enjoy nature or simply rest! It is a pleasure to spend time at Ohori park with friends, family, whoever and there is also a nice museum to visit.
Big park and lake. Nice place for stroll especially among the trees which were marked. Incredible that they were gathering stats of each tree in the park!
Here is one of the places you must visit. Nice place for running, cycling, resting, etc... Until midnight, many people enjoy everything.

Very peaceful and popular with locals - great views, nature, a lake with paddleboats, lots of runners, and friendly dogs. Well worth a visit to stroll around. Fukuoka is not a major tourist city, so a place like this is an ideal area to go relax.
Nice to have a somewhere pleasant for a walk in open space quite close to our hotel. Cafes available in the park bur didn't try ant of them.

A large pleasant park great for relaxing. There's a big pond where you can ride those paddle swan boats, jogging paths, playground for children and a handful of eateries. Saw a lot of families when I went.
It is an obliged spot to visit in Fukuoka, especially if you have the chance to be in this lovely city during the Hanami

Such a pretty and peaceful place to escape the Fukuoka city life. Great place for an afternoon stroll or running session. If you want to escape the people here, just take the path that goes through the lake.

The park has a lot of cherry blossom trees which are beautiful in late March, but otherwise a generic park. There is a Starbucks and some museums, and this is a pleasant place to relax, but not a "must-see" in Fukuoka.

Were there on a very rainy day... our feet got all wet. But the park was worth it, what with castle ruins and all. Most impressive stone work, even if nothing much of the wooden buildings has remained. I'd go there again if I had a chance.

Ohori park is quite charming. It's very relaxing on a sunny spring day! There is a path that takes you around the perimeter of the lake that constitutes the center, and focal point, of the park. A running track also follows the path (about 3km) if you're looking for a place to
easy to go. just get off from the metro station and just walk a few minutes. it is a big park and many local people hanging around for jogging,cycling and leisure walking.

Ohori Park is located (but, really, co-located) just to the west of Maizuru Park. It features an attractive small lake with boat rentals as well as a nice Japanese garden and the Fukuoka City Art Museum. Walking, running, or bicycling around the lake all were popular options
very large park with lake, lots of Sakura to see.. great spot to rest and walk.. Ancient location of Fukuoka Castle.

We went there on a Saturday during the Fukuoka Castle Cherry Blossom Festival. The park was quite crowded but that was to be expected. Still there are a lot of possibilities to sit down. You can also get different kind of food from several food stands. If you want to rent a
great place to relax or exercise or even for a date! good restaurant and boat rental...located just few mins away from Tenjin and Budokan....
It is like a lung of the city., centrally located. Good place for picnic and watching sakura during april.

Same as any of the gardens visited in other cities of japan,this garden is good for walking around n away from the crowd...good scenic spots if you are into photography and the recent half bloom sakura may add some colours to your photos and take time to admire the different

Ohori Park is a modest-sized urban park noted for its lake. Though there is little you could say is spectacular about it, all-in-all it is a pleasant stop. The lake is scenic and small enough that you can comfortably walk around it. It is even shorter to do as most people do and
A nice walk and a great way to take in the quieter side of the city and right next to the castle ruins if you are looking for something more to explore.

We only managed to walk part of the park and visited the Japanese Garden there. The Japanese Garden is not very big but smartly and beautifully designed with trees and waters (ponds, small waterfalls). Worth a visit if you've got time in Hakata.

I alighted at Ohorikoen subway station and took Exit 3 to reach Ohori Park for my evening run last week (mid Feb 2015). I ran around the circumference of the lake which was once a moat of the Fukuoka Castle, and visited the castle ruins; ran passed the Fukuoka Art Museum,
A beautiful park in the middle of the city. We go here every morning for a run, to have a coffee and in the summer to watch the fireworks. Also a great place for people watching!

Ohori Park is close from home. Just walking. Jogging. Running. Lots of pleasures this park. Various birds on the lake. Lake surrounded by various trees. If you coming this park. You say "That's good, that'll do" Maybe I think so.
Very nice park to stroll around and relax. Beautiful architecture surrounded by nature. Bring something to eat while you sit on one of the many benches.

Our visit was in winter, so I'm sure with leaves on the trees and flowers blooming the park would be even more pretty. The place is absolutely huge with a 'pond' (it's massive with multiple islands and pretty bridges), restaurant, castle remains, sports areas, walking tracks
The castle ruins are quite unimpressive, but the bridges, toris and the view are very beautiful. I visited in the winter, nevertheless it was enjoyable!

This is a nice central park for the local to jog, cycling and relax. The track covers around the lake, which gives a nice view. Many local came to jog and cycling even at night. If you enjoy doing what the local do, this is a good place to do your morning or evening

We stayed at hotel Sunline Fukuoka and the park was just a 5 to 10 minutes walk across the road from the hotel. There are many entrances to the park. From our entry point, we walked through a playground area before reaching the park on a Saturday morning (6 Dec 2014). There were
Lucky to be there in Autumn and see the trees in colour. Lots of interesting items and areas, particularly the waterfalls.

Ohori Park was one of our stops on the Fukuoka Bike Tour. It is a beautiful park surrounding a lake. There is a 2 km walking, jogging, and biking path around the lake. On Sunday morning, there were a lot of people out walking, jogging and biking. There were also several

Autumn foliage was fabulous. The lake area is simply peaceful. Only locals come here to jog or walk. Off the beaten path. Nearby there's a Japanese garden (south near the art museum). Don't miss it - autumn or otherwise. Entry is not expensive - 200 yen. There's tea an
Loved exploring the ruins of fukuoka castle nearby~ and it was still autumn-ish!! the various shades of green, oranges and reds made it really beautiful!

Hit regularly by locals for leisure/sports activities, Ohori Park is a nice spot if you want to take a break or do some sport activities. Just a few minutes sitting lakeside watching the ducks swimming can make your mind go away from the city. The Starbucks is not invasive,

The Ohori park is basically a place for relaxation and exercise. Benches are installed surrounding the pond and a path for strolling or jogging. I visited this place last September 2014 as it was listed as one of the recommended sites to visit in the Fukuoka visitor's pamphlet

You can spend hours strolling or just sit and watch the people go by. Many bring their pets along for walks. You can see doggies in bicycle baskets, on leash or on doggy prams. There is a Starbucks where you can have a bite and a cuppa. I visited the Japanese Garden(for a small
Big, tasteful, good walking route, lots of koi and ducks. Families with kids and couples, older joggers can all enjoy. Worth several hours of your day.

Ohori Park is a very beautiful park in the Fukuoka City. There is a pond in the center of the park and many people walk and run around the pond. You can get there very easy by catching the subway from both Hakata and Tenjin. If you feel you need refresh, why don't you walk

Great park to spend some time in during your stay in Fukuoka. We were there on a saturday and the park was fulled with different kind of people. You can enjoy the sun on nice bench at the lake or grab some food or a coffee and go for walk.
Nice small park with typical Japanese sites, good for a run or walk, Japanese garden nearby and also the local Fukuoka Museum and shrine.......
Nothing much here when i got there in July. There's a ruin castle and art museum located near the park. The best time to go there is Sakura season.

I spent several hours here on a beautiful late September day. The lake is huge with great views of the city surrounding the park. There are so many huge carp and lots of turtles as well. The stone bridges/causeway are a pleasant way to cross the lake. The influence from China
This park has a great lake, is relaxing stay and take a look to the people passing by, birds flying around, boats; good place for sports too. has a japanese garden and art museum.
Green with nice walking spaces and a lake in the middle. Lot of peace and quiet. Thumbs up, great place to spend an evening or noon.
the park was very pretty even at night. There was a fairly large play area for children as well and delicious icecream in the vending machine.

This beautiful huge park is reminiscent of NYC's Central Park. We didn't have enough time to walk the entire park but we did explore some playgrounds and enjoyed the sunflowers that lined the pathways. It's pretty and peaceful here with lots to see and do, the perfect mix!
Nice location to see trees and enjoying walk in morning or late afternoon, if you want some cup of coffee you can stop by at starbucks that have very nice spot in this park

This park reminded me of Central Park. There's a lot of activity around but the park is peaceful but there are a good number of people using the wonderful facilities. There are walking paths and trails but also boats to be rented. I walked in the center island bridge and enjoyed
if you want to relax a bit, come to this park! They don't hv too many sightseeing points but will make u feel comfortable to stay there!

The Ohori Park was very beautiful and the island and bridges that cross the middle of the lake are a great way to see the park or to just sit back and relax. There were plenty of people riding in boats, driving boats, and just relaxing when I visited.

Honestly, it still puzzles me why this is the #1 attraction in Fukuoka. Maybe it is because we did not visit this when the cherry blossoms are blooming. We have been to many parks in Japan and this is by far, the least attractive. Very ordinary, in fact. The biggest saving

I love this park! I stayed in Fukuoka on a business trip for around a month and visited this park on the weekends. There are cycle tracks and jogging lanes around the beautiful lake for people who wanted to get some exercise. There were peaceful benches in quiet spots to sit
Taking a walk around Ohori park viewing the Cherry Blossom was relaxing and there were a few places to visit other than the Ohori Park, like the castle ruins and the museum..
Very good park and have tipical Japanese sights. there's a museum near this park and very easy to access from hakata station and fukuoka airport.

This city recreational park is designed around a large lake, with a long bridge across the middle of the lake, and a wide space for people to walk/run/cycle/amble around the lake. It's got an ambience of peacefulness and content, with so many people indulged in relaxing and/or

Very pretty park with "lake" and island. Lots of locals enjoying the outdoors and Cherry Blossoms! Easy, safe, pleasant walk through park and made a nice early morning activity before most businesses opened. Easy access by subway.
Beautiful walk through this manicured garden. Many people walking and using the running track. Track crosses over a few islands with attractive bridges, good for photo opportunities.

Have breakfast at Bakery Kitchen Raggruppi (http://www.raggruppi.net/) before taking a stroll in the beautiful Ohori Park. Check out the Japanese Garden as well if you have some cash to spare (¥200 per person)
I went there for a short walk around. It is peaceful and nice. There is a starbucks shop in the park as well so I stopped for a cup of coffee there to see people walking, jogging and talking.

This is a great park. It has huge lily ponds. Just beautiful. The city has many functions, including the largest fireworks show in the area during the summer. Well worth the visit to see. It is also an original location for the area baseball field.
Great for a stroll, very peaceful. Would recommend bringing a book and reading along the waterfront or in the pavilion in the middle of the lake!

the US Embassy is just near by. lots of nice flowers in Spring and winter time lots of people walking doing their exercise. Cool place to be for a nice spring picnic. Took my family there via the subway and have fond memories there.
Loved this park just to go for a stroll and relax. Loads of turtles in the ponds and excellent spots for photographs!

Ohori has a nice track around the lake that is split between joggers and walkers. My kids learned to ride there bikes there. The fireworks display in August draws a lot of participants and really helps give you a taste of festival life in Japan. Now they have a Starbucks

Ohori Park is good for taking leisurely walks and it is easily accessible via the subway (Ohori-koen stop). I went in early Nov, and the trees were not yet in fall foilage. There is a Japanese garden (a fee is needed) within Ohori Park. It's quite a nice place, though a bit

After a hearty lunch and a busy morning, Ohori park provides the relaxing venue with its grandiose lake in the center. Strolling across the long bridge to the island at the center of the lake proved very relaxing and pleasurable to the senses. What surprised us most were these

a lovely park to walk around large lake in the middle and some lovely Japanese bridges to cross there is also a Japanese garden to walk around which is so beautiful. look out for the jumping fish in the lake they leap right up out of the water
Great place on a sunny day to go for a jog, walk or bike ride. We visited here on our first day in Fukuoka on rented bikes traveling from Tenjin to Fukuoka Tower.

This is worth visiting for a couple of hours, say a morning stroll, around the lake with a visit to the Fukuoka Art Museum that sits within the grounds. It is like a mini Hyde Park and Serpentine Lake, with pine cones to collect (rather than conkers). There's also a very

Beautiful park with a big pond, where we can enjoy boat or just relax on a bench. A walking trail around the pond is about 2km, good for a casual walk. Starbucks in the park is a good stop when tired a little.

The park is very beautiful and is a nice place to relax. The castle ruins are literally right next to the park. There is a Starbucks in the park as well as many cultural structures. If you are nearby the park, I would strongly recommend going there.

This is safe park with 2km jogging course. You can enjoy jogging and walking 24 hours. American Consulate is located near by many polices are guarding around this park. They have coffee shops and restaurants in the park you can take lunch or coffee break. Close to subway station

text.wiki:
Fukuoka Convention Center (福岡国際会議場) in Fukuoka, Japan is a collection of three separate buildings operated by the Fukuoka Convention Center Foundation.


== Fukuoka Kokusai Center ==

The Fukuoka Kokusai Center opened in 1981. A Sumo Tournament is held here every November. Many Grand Sumo Tournaments are held here and all attract many visitors.


== Marine Messe Fukuoka ==

Marine Messe Fukuoka opened in 1995.  One of its main uses is as an indoor sporting arena. The capacity of the arena is up to 15,000 people for sports events and up to 13,000 people for concerts. It hosted the official 1999 Asian Basketball Championship and some of the group games for the 2006 Volleyball World Championship.Japanese musicians Misia, Koda Kumi, and Ayumi Hamasaki commonly play here for arena tours.


== Fukuoka International Congress Center ==
The Fukuoka International Congress Center opened in 2003.


== Events ==


=== Past events ===
1999 Asian Basketball Championship
2001 World Aquatics Championships
2006 International Political Science Association world congresses
2011 The First Japan Arena Tour (Girls' Generation)
2013 Girls & Peace: 2nd Japan Tour Girls' Generation
2014 Girls' Generation Japan 3rd Tour
2015 Exo Planet 2 – The Exo'luxion
2016 Exo Planet 3 – The Exo'rdium
2016 iKON Japan Tour 2016-2017 
2017 Exo Planet 4 – The EℓyXiOn
2017 iKON Japan Dome Tour 2017 
2017 BTS Live Trilogy Episode III: The Wings Tour
2018 Blackpink Arena Tour 2018
2018 Aqours 3rd LoveLive! Tour ～WONDERFUL STORIES～
2019 Red Velvet 2nd Concert "Redmare"
2019 Seventeen - Seventeen 2019 Japan Tour 'HARU'
2019 Iz*One - IZ*ONE 1st Concert "Eyes On Me"

This is a list of well known Shinto shrines in Japan. Shrines with structures that are National Treasures of Japan are covered by the List of National Treasures of Japan (shrines). For Shinto shrines in other countries, scroll down to the See also section.
Shinto shrines from specific sects or new churches are not included in this list.

sights.name: Fukuoka Anpanman Children's Museum in Mall

text.wiki:
Yokohama Anpanman Children's Museum (横浜アンパンマンこどもミュージアム, Yokohama Anpanman Kodomo Myūjiamu) is a complex in Minato Mirai 21, Yokohama, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. Dedicated to Takashi Yanase's popular Anpanman franchise. It is one of five such complexes in Japan (the others being in Kobe, Sendai, Nagoya and Fukuoka).
In 2019, this facility moved to the neighborhood, removed "& Mall" from the facility name and renamed it "Yokohama Anpanman Children's Museum".

		


== External links ==
Official website (in Japanese)
text.quote: Colorful children's play area in a mall with many interactive activities & frequent dancing shows.
